topic.title: Now Available: Foreign Relations of the United States, 1981–1988, Volume XXIV, North Africa
topic.body: The volume details the Reagan administration’s overall approach to North Africa, its conception of the region as it related to broader U.S. geopolitical goals, and its attempts to address the wide, often interrelated, range of political, economic, and strategic challenges posed to U.S. interests in the area.
topic.image-description: Book Cover of Foreign Relations of the United States, 1981-1988, Volume XXIV, North Africa
topic.image-source-information: Created by the Office of the Historian
